bill_title: conduct a study on public railroad infrastructure in South Dakota and to appropriate money for a study.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to conduct a study on public railroad infrastructure in South Dakota and to appropriate money for a study. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The secretary of transportation shall conduct a study of the public railroad infrastructure in South Dakota. The study shall include an analysis of expansion to the public railroad system. The secretary shall submit a report detailing the information collected to the Governor and the Eighty-first Legislature. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of fifty thousand dollars ($50,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Transportation for the purpose of conducting a study of the public railroad infrastructure in South Dakota. Section 3. The secretary of the Department of Transportation shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated by this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2006, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
